metadata.author: Panaderia Libre
metadata.description: A formula for stovetop stuffing featuring dried sourdough bread cubes and a flavorful seasoning mix.

may_contain_traces_of: Nuts (cross-contamination from seasoning mix or bread production)
allergens.notes: Ensure all ingredients are sourced from allergen-safe facilities if needed.

making: Bring 1.5 cups (360 mL) of water to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons (28g) of melted butter (not included).
Add the entire contents of the stuffing mix package (bread cubes and seasoning) to the saucepan.
Stir well to combine, ensuring all bread cubes are moistened.
Cover the saucepan and let it sit for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork before serving.
storage: Keep the product in its original sealed packaging in a cool, dry place.
Once prepared, refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
reheating: To reheat, place stuffing in an oven-safe dish and cover with foil. Heat in an oven at 180°C (350°F) for 10-15 minutes.
Alternatively, microwave individual portions in a microwave-safe dish for 1-2 minutes until warmed.
usage: Serve as a side dish for roasted poultry, pork, or beef.
Use as a filling for stuffed vegetables like bell peppers or squash.
Incorporate leftovers into soups or casseroles.

changes: Initial release of stovetop stuffing formula.
